pageContext.description: Screw-twisted from a single rod; the ends are plain. It threads 2 small gold rings of a small ribbed pattern, about 6.5mm in diameter; possibly these were used to keep the armlet closed.
pageContext.publications: Messrs. Sotheby's Catalogue of the Day Sale, May 1913, p. 61, No. 416
pageContext.collection: National Museum of Science & Art, Dublin, Plate XIII, 99., formerly in the Collection of R. Day Esq. F.S.A.
